skill.name: brainstorming
skill.tagline: Turn ideas into fully formed designs through collaborative dialogue
skill.summary: This skill helps you brainstorm and refine creative ideas before implementation. It guides you through understanding requirements, exploring approaches, and validating information to create solid designs. The process is conversational, with incremental validation at each step.

steps.name: Understand Context
steps.description: Review current project state including files, documentation, and recent changes

steps.name: Refine the Idea
steps.description: Ask focused questions one at a time to clarify purpose, constraints, and success criteria

steps.name: Explore Approaches
steps.description: Propose 2-3 different approaches with trade-offs and recommend the best option

steps.name: Validate Information
steps.description: Check sources, recency, and resolve conflicts before using any information

steps.name: Present Design
steps.description: Break the design into small sections and get feedback after each part

steps.name: Update Plan
steps.description: If in plan mode, update the plan file with the finalized design

principles: One question at a time - Don't overwhelm with multiple questions
Multiple choice preferred - Easier to answer than open-ended when possible
YAGNI ruthlessly - Remove unnecessary features from all designs
Ground Truth First - Use web search to validate facts; don't rely on stale knowledge
Verify Validity - Check source, date, and time of external info before using it
Guardrails - Never present assumptions as facts; validate before concluding
Explore alternatives - Always propose 2-3 approaches before settling
Incremental validation - Present design in sections, validate each
Be flexible - Go back and clarify when something doesn't make sense
